description: Hurricane Florence is near the North Carolina coast. Channel 2 Action News has meteorologists in New Bern, Wilmington, Myrtle Beach and Savannah.
title: Where is Hurricane Florence now?
title_page: Hurricane Florence: Where is Hurricane Florence now?
text:
Hurricane Florence is now a tropical depression, according to the latest Channel 2 Action News reports.
Florence has been downgraded, but flooding continues and has already led to the deaths of a mother and baby, according to an earlier AJC report.
The National Hurricane Center, www.nhc.noaa.gov, says Florence “continues to produce widespread heavy rains over parts of North Carolina and northeastern South Carolina into western Virginia. Flash flooding will continue over portions of the western mid-Atlantic region.”
As of Monday morning, the storm was 125 miles west southwest of Roanoke, Virginia, and 145 miles west northwest of Greensboro, North Carolina, with sustained winds of 30 miles.
